author: 三立新聞網
title: 微軟裁員風暴未歇！1原因大砍6000人 這職位首當其衝
text:
三立新聞網 setn.com 微軟裁員風暴未歇！1原因大砍6000人 這職位首當其衝 閱讀全文
三立新聞網 2025年6月18日 下午8:27 財經中心／王文承報導
微軟將在7月初公布新一波裁員計畫，預計大砍6000名銷售相關職位。（圖／翻攝自google） ▲微軟將在7月初公布新一波裁員計畫，預計大砍6000名銷售相關職位。（圖／翻攝自google）
美國科技巨頭微軟（Microsoft）近年來持續進行裁員與組織縮編，如今又傳出將在7月初公布新一波裁員計畫，預計大砍6000名銷售相關職位。知情人士透露，微軟不斷調整人力結構，主要是為了平衡AI領域日益龐大的支出。
根據《彭博》報導，繼5月已裁員約6000人後，微軟正準備在7月再進行一次裁員行動。此次瞄準目標將集中於銷售業務團隊。事實上，早在今年4月，微軟就曾告知員工，公司計劃將更多中小企業客戶的銷售業務交由第三方公司負責，為裁員埋下伏筆。
雖然微軟目前對此次裁員消息未予置評，但公司過去曾表示，會定期重新評估組織結構，以確保資源能有效投資於成長領域。相關人士指出，微軟在AI技術上的投入金額龐大，為了控制整體支出，只能透過裁員等方式降低成本。
截至去年6月，微軟全球員工總數約為22.8萬人，其中約4.5萬人為銷售與行銷職位。由於微軟財政年度通常在6月底結束，過去也常在此期間宣布組織重整與人事變動。

author: Mark and Debbie Himsel
title: Letter: Proud to support Susan Moore-Fontenot
text:
We confidently support Susan Moore-Fontenot for reelection to the Lee College Board of Regents. Susan has a proven track record of leadership and dedication to the Lee College community. It would be difficult to list the many programs she has initiated and successfully championed. Her commitment and leadership serving on both state and national community college boards greatly benefit Lee College.
Much has been accomplished under her leadership, yet some of our greatest challenges lie ahead. Behind her decades of experience as an educator lies a deep passion and perseverance to help students improve their lives through higher education. Susan brings more than experience. She brings vision. Her institutional knowledge, paired with her active involvement at state and national levels of community college leadership make her an irreplaceable asset. She has raised Lee College’s profile among government leaders and continues to represent our students and community with integrity.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->corporate news and profiles

author: LA NACION
title: La Argentina, primera en el ranking con la peor expectativa de empleo del mundo
text:
Forbes Argentina La Argentina, primera en el ranking con la peor expectativa de empleo del mundo Leer todo el artículo Forbes Argentina 28 de diciembre de 2023, 4:05 p. m. · 3 min de lectura
ManpowerGroup presentó los resultados de la Encuesta de Expectativas de Empleo correspondiente al primer trimestre de 202 4, que refiere al período de enero a marzo. Este resultado fue obtenido tras encuestar a más de 700 empleadores argentinos, quienes reportaron una Expectativa Neta de Empleo (ENE) de +2% ajustado por estacionalidad, demostrando un declive de 6 puntos porcentuales en comparación con el último trimestre del 2023.
Los resultados revelan que el 30% de los empleadores encuestados planea aumentar sus dotaciones de personal, el 29% disminuirlas, el 35% no espera realizar cambios y el 6% restante no sabe si los realizará durante el periodo relevado.
Cabe destacar que el valor de la ENE se obtiene al tomar el porcentaje de empleadores que espera incrementar sus plantillas y restar el porcentaje de aquellos que proyectan una disminución durante el próximo trimestre.
"La incertidumbre sobre el desempeño de la economía anticipa una fuerte reducción en las expectativas de contratación de las empresas durante el primer trimestre del año", advierte Luis Guastini, Director General y Presidente de ManpowerGroup Argentina y Director de Talent Solutions para Latinoamérica . Y agrega: "Esto lo vemos reflejado en los resultados de nuestro estudio trimestral; los empleadores están adoptando una postura más cautelosa en sus decisiones de contratación lo que va a contramano de lo que se observa en el resto de los países de la región".
Comparaciones por sector
En cuatro de las nueve actividades económicas relevadas los empleadores esperan incrementar sus nóminas durante el primer trimestre de 2024. El sector de Tecnología de la Información lidera esta tendencia, con una ENE de +14%, seguido por Energía y Servicios Públicos, con +8%, e Industrias y Materiales con +5%. Mientras que quienes reportan las expectativas de contratación más débiles son Finanzas y Real Estate con una ENE de -12%, seguido por Sanidad y Ciencias de la Vida que refleja una ENE del -11%.
Continuar leyendo la historia Expectativas laborales: ¿qué le pide cada generación al mercado de trabajo? | Capital Humano En comparación con el último trimestre del 2023, las expectativas de contratación se debilitan en los nueve sectores industriales relevados. El mayor declive es reportado por Sanidad y Ciencias de la Vida, revelando una disminución de 34 puntos porcentuales, seguido por Servicios de Comunicación, con un decrecimiento de 20 puntos.
En la comparación interanual, las expectativas se debilitan en las nueve actividades económicas. Las disminuciones más significativas en las intenciones de contratación se observan en Finanzas y Real Estate y Servicios de Comunicación, con 44 y 21 puntos porcentuales respectivamente.
Comparaciones regionales
En cinco de las seis regiones del país encuestadas, los empleadores esperan aumentar sus nóminas durante el primer trimestre del 2024. La región de Cuyo lidera esta tendencia, con una ENE de +11%, seguido por el Noroeste Argentino (NOA), con una ENE +5%, mientras que la región Pampeana arroja las expectativas de contratación más débiles, revelando una ENE de -1%.
Las expectativas de empleo ante el cambio generacional En comparación con el periodo relevado anteriormente, los resultados de la Encuesta indican que las intenciones de contratación aumentan en dos de las seis regiones. La región de Cuyo lidera esta tendencia con un incremento de 5 puntos porcentuales, seguido por el NOA, con una mejora de 2 puntos. Mientras que el Noreste Argentino (NEA) muestra un decrecimiento de 13 puntos porcentuales.
En la comparación interanual, las expectativas disminuyen en las seis regiones. Los declives más significativos en las intenciones de contratación se observan en el NEA y la región Pampeana, con 19 y 15 puntos porcentuales respectivamente.
En el resto del mundo
En América, los empleadores de los once países relevados esperan aumentos en sus expectativas de contratación para el primer trimestre de 2024. Costa Rica y Estados Unidos presentan las expectativas más altas de la región (+35%), seguido por México (+34%). Por el contrario, Argentina es el país que arroja las expectativas más débiles de la región (+2%), seguido por Perú (+23%) y Canadá (+25%).
A nivel mundial, los empleadores proyectan aumentar sus nóminas en los 41 países y territorios encuestados.
MÁS POPULARES 1. ¿Por qué está cayendo tanto el dólar en Colombia al cierre de 2023? 2. Nadie ve un superpeso más fuerte en 2024, ni el gobierno 3. Milei pone fin al programa "Precios Justos" y nace "Precios diferenciados": supermercados y productos adheridos 4. Autoridades señalan que el sistema financiero mexicano se mantiene "sólido y resiliente" 5. Buscan profesionales de varias áreas y pagan sueldos de $1,5 millones: requisitos y dónde aplicar

author: Kinsey Crowley
title: Rogue wave injures 8 in Ventura, California: Video
text: Videos out of Ventura, California captured the moment a rogue wave jumped over a seawall Thursday, sweeping aside the cars and people in its path. Ventura isn't the only place experiencing tumultuous coasts. The National Weather Service has issued surf and flooding advisories along the California coast and in Hawaii. A video from Ventura officials opens on a seemingly tranquil scene. People are scattered along the seawall, leaning against it and watching the rolling waves in the distance. Suddenly, people start to back away from the wall moments before a wave spikes up in front of them. As it crashes down into the street, many of the people running get their feet knocked out from under them and a truck seems to skip forward in the waves. Another angle captured by Facebook user Colin Hoag shows the waves chasing him down the street. Officials urged people to avoid the ocean. High surf is expected through Saturday. Rogue waves: A rogue wave caused a cruise ship tragedy. They occur more often than you think. The Ventura County Fire Department was called to the scene of the wave shortly before 11 a.m. Thursday. "It ended up being a total of eight patients due to surf that came over the wall and flooded the streets," Ventura County Fire Capt. Brian McGrath said. The injured were taken to the nearby hospitals. Residents in the neighborhoods near the incident were advised to leave, said Cmdr. Ryan Weeks with the Ventura Police Department. The patrons of a nearby hotel were also asked to leave. Roads in and around those areas were also closed. A National Weather Service meteorologist said a storm system over the Pacific is churning up swells. Here are the coastal weather warnings and watches issued by local NWS offices as a result of the storms: NSW Los Angeles Office - "Dangerous Beach Conditions " NWS San Diego Office - "Marine and Coastal Hazards" NWS San Francisco Office - All counties covered are under: Honolulu, Hawaii NWS Office

author: Cryptopolitan
title: 3,000 Investors in Just Two Weeks, Is Mutuum Finance (MUTM) the Next Must-Have Token?
text:
The crypto market is always evolving, and while many projects struggle to maintain traction, Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is proving to be different. In just two weeks, its presale has attracted 3,000 investors, raising over $1.5 million as early buyers rush to secure their share at $0.015 per token. With strong fundamentals and real financial utility, many are seeing MUTM as a serious contender in the DeFi space.
Unlike many speculative projects that rely on hype, Mutuum Finance offers a practical use case, a decentralized lending and borrowing platform designed to give users more control over their assets. Investors seeking chances for passive income and long-term growth are turning to MUTM due to its structured financial mechanism, which guarantees sustainability and ongoing demand.
Through the DeFi lending mechanism, borrowers can obtain liquidity without having to liquidate their holdings, and users can contribute assets and generate passive income. This dual-function system increases token utility, which is why many investors see it as a must-have token for 2025.
Mutuum Finance’s presale success has been nothing short of impressive. With 140 million tokens sold in just two weeks, it’s clear that investors are confident in the project’s potential. The first presale phase sold out quickly, and in Phase 2, tokens are still available at $0.015, offering a prime opportunity before the price increases in the next stages.
A key component of Mutuum Finance are mtTokens, which act as interest-bearing assets for customers that supply liquidity. For example, when a user deposits Ethereum, they get mtETH, which automatically increases in value as interest is accumulated. This also holds true for stablecoins like mtDAI, which give users a steady passive income stream without expecting them to trade actively.
This feature, which allows users to produce yield while maintaining exposure to their initial assets, sets Mutuum Finance apart from traditional loan platforms. Sustaining continuous engagement with the environment requires this system.
To maintain long-term value, Mutuum Finance employs a buy-and-distribute mechanism. A portion of platform revenue is used to buy back MUTM tokens from the market, creating continuous buying pressure and reducing sell-offs. These tokens are then distributed to stakers and suppliers, ensuring that early investors benefit from long-term token appreciation.
With this structure in place, MUTM is anticipated to appreciate in value over time, making it an appealing choice for investors who are not just interested in short-term profits.
Mutuum Finance has a clear roadmap and is a fully structured DeFi technology, making it more than simply another altcoin. In order to increase demand and adoption, the team intends to launch a beta version of the platform by the time the coin debuts.
With experts forecasting a 15x growth post-launch, investing in MUTM during the presale is a strategic move for those seeking high returns. For example, an investor who puts in $2,200 at $0.015 per token will see their holdings grow to $33,000 once MUTM reaches $0.225, a realistic target based on its rising demand and strong financial model. With the presale gaining momentum, this is the best time to secure tokens before prices climb higher.
As more investors recognize Mutuum Finance’s potential, demand is expected to increase rapidly, making the presale one of the best entry points before major price movements.
With 3,000 investors onboard and $1.5 million already raised, Mutuum Finance is proving to be more than just another altcoin. Its DeFi lending model, passive income opportunities, and structured tokenomics make it a project with long-term potential.
As Bitcoin and Ethereum struggle with market fluctuations, MUTM is emerging as a stable, high-growth alternative. With strong investor backing and a solid roadmap, it might just be one of the most promising tokens of 2025.
